fields.value: Massachusetts Archives Collection. v.41-Judicial, 1725-1742. SC1/series 45X, Petition of Robert Auchmuty

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Petition subject: Court cases

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:13906009

Date of creation: 17390000

Petition location: Boston

Selected signatures:

  1. Robert Auchmuty

Actions taken on dates: 1739-10-04,1739-10-04,1739-10-05,1739-12-14,1739-12-14,1739-12-19

Legislative action: Received in the Council on October 4, 1739 and read and ordered and sent for concurrence and received in the House on October 4, 1739 and read and concurred and consented to on October 5, 1739 and received in the Council on December 14, 1739 and read again together with the answer of Hewes and ordered and sent for concurrence and received in the House on December 14, 1739 and read and concurred and consented to on December 19, 1739

Total signatures: 1

Legislative action summary: Received, read, ordered, sent, received, read, concurred, consented, received, read, ordered, sent, received, read, concurred, consented

Legal voter signatures (males not identified as non-legal): 1

Female only signatures: No

Identifications of signatories: Nathaniel Cunningham, merchant

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Additional archivist notes: Nathaniel Cunningham, George Hewes, Robert Hewes, Cato, Nero, Quagno, Scipio, [additional documents in volumes]

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: Massachusetts Archives volume 41, pages 425-427

Acknowledgements: Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities (PW-5105612), Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth, Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study at Harvard University, Center for American Political Studies at Harvard University, Institutional Development Initiative at Harvard University, and Harvard University Library.
